oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Analysis of multivariate genotype - environment data using Nonlinear Canonical Correlation Analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pinnschmidt, H.O.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nonlinear Canonical Correlation Analysis (NCCA) is a method well suited for visualising the main features in multivariate data of various scales. NCCA is useful for obtaining an overall orientation of genotype properties and environment characteristics.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Pinnschmidt, H.O. (2004) Analysis of multivariate genotype - environment data using Nonlinear Canonical Correlation Analysis. Speech at: COST 860 SUSVAR Focus Finding Workshop, University Kassel-Witzenhausen, 11-13 October 2004.
